subclassFeature.name: Path of the Brute
entries: While most barbarians hail from the wild places of the world, brutes discovered their Rage in the underbelly of civilization. Their abilities stem from a combination of street smarts and pure grit. All those who follow this Path share one thing in common, they prefer to solve their problems with their fists.

subclassFeature.name: The Wrong Crowd
entries: You have a way of connecting with the less savory members of society. Once you spend a night carousing in a settlement, you have advantage on ability checks to gather information on the settlement, its culture, factions, and powerful figures.

subclassFeature.name: Unarmed & Dangerous
entries: You have honed your body into a deadly weapon. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier instead of the normal damage of an unarmed strike. If you have two free hands, the d4 damage die becomes a {@dice d6}.
You also gain the benefits below while you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}:

items: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn and make only unarmed strike attacks, you can make an additional unarmed strike as part of that same Attack action.
Once per turn, when you hit with an unarmed strike, you can attempt to {@action grapple} the target as part of that same attack so long you have a free hand to grapple the target.

subclassFeature.name: Concussive Blows
entries: Your powerful strikes send your foes reeling. While {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical damage.

In addition, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failure, it is {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Grip
entries: Once you have a hold of something it is nearly impossible for it to escape your grasp. You gain the following benefits:

items: The size of creatures that you can {@action grapple} increases by one size. When you grapple a creature more than one size larger than you, it can move as normal, but you move with it so long as there is an unoccupied space adjacent to it.
While you are dragging a grappled creature that is one size larger than you or smaller, your speed isn't reduced.
While {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, the damage die for your unarmed strikes becomes {@damage 1d6}, or {@damage 1d8} if you have two free hands.
You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

subclassFeature.name: Brutish Determination
entries: You can shrug off physical blows that would devastate lesser warriors. When you make a Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, or death saving throw, you roll a {@dice d4} and add it to your roll.
Should you roll a 20 or higher on a death saving throw, you instantly regain consciousness and stand up with 1 hit point.
Finally, while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging} the damage die for your unarmed strikes becomes {@damage 1d8}, or {@damage 1d10} if you have two free hands.

activation.condition: When you make a Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, or death saving throw

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Champion
entries: At the front of every great fighting force stands a Champion. These elite warriors are true masters of battle that stand as paragons of honorable combat and fair play. Often, they seek out the most powerful of their foes and look to swiftly end conflicts with honorable duels or athletic competitions.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Your enhance your Rage with martial technique. You learn a Fighting Style from the list below. You can't learn a Fighting Style more than once, even if you gain this feature again.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can switch your Fighting Style for another option from the list below.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Training
entries: Your great strength makes your attacks especially deadly. While you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, your melee and thrown weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
At 14th level, all of your melee and thrown weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18 through 20 on the d20.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Blow
entries: You can use your Rage to fuel a single mighty blow. When you hit a creature with an attack while you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can instantly end your Rage to turn the attack into a critical hit.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use your Rage to fuel a blow like this again.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you hit a creature with an attack while you are Raging

subclassFeature.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: You can regularly perform feats of athleticism that would be impossible for most mortals. Whenever you make a Strength or Constitution check, or calculate the distance you can jump, you add your Rage Damage bonus to your result.

subclassFeature.name: Invigorating Critical
entries: The chaos and adrenaline of battle fuel your fighting spirit. Whenever you score a critical hit with a weapon attack, you instantly regain hit points hit points equal to your Rage Damage bonus + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

activation.condition: Whenever you score a critical hit with a weapon attack

subclassFeature.name: Survivor
entries: You are a near-perfect specimen of physical vigor. You gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point) at the start of each of your turns so long as you are not {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Deep
entries: Encounters with the great and terrible things that dwell deep beneath the waves often irreparably shatter the minds of the weak willed. However, some who live through these traumatic experiences with eldritch horrors awaken an otherworldly Rage that is rarely experienced on the material plane.

subclassFeature.name: Gift of the Depths
entries: You have been irreparably changed by your exposure to the unknowable horrors of the deep. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, you can breathe both air and water, and you gain resistance to cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Grasp
entries: Your eldritch influence manifests itself when you Rage. Whenever you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, you manifest one additional appendage, the appearance of which reflects the nature of the eldritch creature that infused you with strange power. Your eldritch appendage lasts for the duration of your Rage.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can cause this appendage to lash out, forcing one target you can see within 15 feet to make a Strength saving throw (Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failure, it is pulled up to 15 feet toward you in a line.
If your target is one size larger than you or larger, it has advantage on its Strength saving throw to resist this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Reality Warp
entries: Your mind-altering experiences allow you to identify, and slip through, the cracks in reality. As an action, you can teleport along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet. This does not provoke opportunity attacks. Immediately before or after you do so, you can make one attack as part of the same action.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all of your expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Tendrils
entries: The otherworldly eldritch influence within your body truly reveals itself in your fury. When you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, you can manifest up to two eldritch appendages which last until the end of your Rage.

As a bonus action, you can cause both appendages to use {@subclassFeature Otherworldly Grasp|Barbarian||Deep|llbarb|3}, or try to {@action grapple} a creature you can see within 15 feet. Each appendage can target the same, or different, creatures. If they target the same creature, it the target disadvantage on its saving throw (Otherworldly Grasp) or ability check (grapple). Each appendage can use the same, or a different feature as part of the same bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: The Horrors Below
entries: When you travel through the cracks in reality, you can reveal the eldritch horrors beyond this world. When you use {@subclassFeature Reality Warp|Barbarian||Deep|llbarb|6}, you can force creatures within 10 feet of the point you appear to make a Wisdom saving throw (Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, creatures take {@damage 2d8} psychic damage and are {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, they take half as much psychic damage and aren't frightened.
Creatures that are immune to the frightened condition are immune to the effects of this feature, including any damage.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Favored
entries: For most Barbarians, their Rage is drawn from their lust for battle or a desire for revenge, but for others, their Rage is a gift. Warriors who walk the Path of the Favored receive their Rage from an outside source. Some are blessed by Fate to be mighty warriors, others are the scions of gods or archfey, and others are the descendants of legendary adventurers. These warriors use this favor to find success where all others fail.

subclassFeature.name: Favored Presence
entries: There is something about your physicality that causes others view you more favorably. When you meet a creature for the first time, its starting attitude is one level higher than normal. For example, a hostile creature would view you indifferently, or a creature that would view you indifferently may consider you friendly. This feature doesn't effect those you travel with.

subclassFeature.name: Fate-Touched
entries: An outside force has blessed you find success where others would fail. You gain a number of {@dice d6} Fate Dice equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). Whenever you miss with an attack roll, or you fail an ability check or saving throw you can expend one of these Fate Dice and add it to your roll, possibly turning a failure or miss into a success.
You regain all of your expended Fate Dice when you finish a long rest. Moreover, if you score a critical hit or roll a 20 on a {@dice d20} for a saving throw, you regain one expended Fate Die.

subclassFeature.name: Glorious Cause
entries: Your near-supernatural ability to succeed motivates all who follow you into battle. When you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, you can expend a Fate Die. You, and a number of creatures of your choice within 30 feet, up to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), gain temporary hit points equal to 1 + your Fate Die roll.

subclassFeature.name: Tireless Hero
entries: When you enter a {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1} or roll initiative and have no Fate Dice remaining, you regain one of your expended Fate Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Wondrous Success
entries: You have learned to channel the supernatural power that guides your favored path through life. When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can choose to use your Barbarian level in place of the {@dice d20} roll. You can use this feature after you roll, but before you know if your ability check, attack roll, or saving throw succeeds or fails.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw

subclassFeature.name: Strength Overwhelming
entries: You have become more than mortal, and can perform feats of supernatural strength that rival heroes of legend. As an action you can expend one use of {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1} to attempt a feat of godlike strength. For this action, the amount of weight you can move is equal to 50 times your Strength score.

Moreover, when you use this feature, you can expend Hit Dice to increase your strength even further. You can expend a total number of your Hit Dice, up to your Strength modifier, multiplying the amount of weight you can move as part of this action by 10 for each Hit Die you expend.
For each size category you are above Medium, the amount of weight you can move as part of this feature doubles again.

For example, a Medium sized Barbarian with 20 Strength could expend one Hit Die when they this feature, multiplying their 20 Strength by 60 (50 + 10), to lift up to 1,200 pounds. If they were Large, they would double this to 2,400 pounds.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Inferno
entries: Across the lower planes, the eternal conflict between law and chaos rages. Devils against Demons, vying for control of the hells. Sometimes this conflict spills over into material plane and the corrupting influence of the Abyss infects the souls of mortals. Cultists and worshipers of Archdemons that seek out affliction with this power walk the Path of the Inferno.

subclassFeature.name: Abyssal Hide
entries: The corruption of the Abyss overtakes you when you Rage, causing your physical features to become demonic in nature. While {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you gain the following additional benefits:

items: You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action, so long as you use this movement to move toward a hostile creature.
When you make a {@classFeature Reckless Attack|Barbarian||2}, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier.

activation.condition: As a bonus action, or when you make a Reckless Attack

subclassFeature.name: Hellish Presence
entries: The chaotic power of the Abyss empowers your force of personality. You gain proficiency in {@skill Intimidation}, and when you make a Strength ({@skill Intimidation}) or Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 7 or lower as an 8.
In addition, you learn to speak {@language Abyssal}, the blasphemous language of Demons and the Abyss.

subclassFeature.name: Unbridled Fury
entries: The chaos of the Abyss infects your Rage. When a creature you can see hits you with a melee attack while you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can use your reaction to make one melee attack against that creature. You can make this attack as a {@classFeature Reckless Attack|Barbarian||2}.

subclassFeature.name: Corrupt Resilience
entries: The power of the Abyss increases your resilience. You gain resistance to fire and poison damage.

Moreover, when you are forced to make a saving throw to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Chaos Overwhelming
entries: You can draw out the full power of the Abyssal influence that fuels you. When you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, you gain one of the abilities below for the duration of that Rage. As a bonus action while Raging, you can expend a use of Rage to switch to another feature:

entries.name: Accursed Limbs
entries: Your limbs grow unnaturally muscular and lengthen. Your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and the range of your melee attacks and reach increase by 5 feet.

entries.name: Defiled Hide
entries: Your skin becomes blighted and covered in hair, boils, or oily scales. You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. Attacks from {@quickref Silvered Weapons|PHB|1|0|silvered weapons} ignore this immunity.

entries.name: Vile Flight
entries: You sprout leathery demonic wings from your back which burst through any clothing you are wearing. You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Lycan
entries: Lycnathropy is an ancient curse that changes those afflicted into mindless beasts with a wild hunger for flesh. However, there are some who purposefully contract this dreaded curse. Willing to give themselves over so that they may use this feral power to rid the world of other lycanthropes.
The barbarians who walk this Path often gain their power from an aging mentor who seeks an apprentice to take up the mantle of the hunt for the monsters cursed with lycanthropy.

subclassFeature.name: Animal Form
entries: You have learned to control your lycanthropy and can shift your physical form at will. As an action on your turn, you can transform into the Animal Form of your lycanthropy, much like a Druid takes the shapes of beasts with Wild Shape.

Choose a {@filter beast of CR 1 or lower|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&0;&1]|type=beast} that best represents the animal your lycanthropic curse is based on. Common beasts include {@creature boar|mm|boars}, {@creature brown bear|mm|brown bears}, {@creature dire wolf|mm|dire wolves}, {@creature tiger|mm|tigers}, and {@creature rat|mm|rats}. This choice is permanent as it reflects the unchanging nature of your curse, and cannot be changed short of a {@spell wish} spell.
When you transform into your Animal Form, you follow all the rules of the {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid||2} feature from the Druid class, which can be found in Chapter 3 of the Player's Handbook.
You can remain in your Animal form for up to 1 hour. Your transformation ends early if you drop to 0 hit points, or you use a bonus action to revert back to your normal form.
Once you shift into your Animal Form, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again. If you have no uses left, you can expend a use of Rage to transform again.

subclassFeature.name: Hybrid Form
entries: Your Rage draws out the power of your inner beast. When you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, you can transform into a Hybrid Form, a fusion between beast and humanoid. While in your Hybrid Form, you gain the benefits below for the duration of your Rage:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.
Your fingers and teeth become claws and fangs that count as simple weapons with the light property. On hit, they deal {@damage 1d6} slashing (claws) or piercing (fangs) damage.
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Savage Instinct
entries: The curse that flows in your veins empowers your senses. When you make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check that relies on your hearing, sight, or smell you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

Also, your natural weapon attacks in both your {@subclassFeature Animal Form|Barbarian||Lycan|llbarb|3||Animal} and {@subclassFeature Hybrid Form|Barbarian||Lycan|llbarb|3||Hybrid Forms} count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Lycan Warrior
entries: You draw on the full power of your curse. When you shift into {@subclassFeature Animal Form|Barbarian||Lycan|llbarb|3||Animal} or {@subclassFeature Hybrid Form|Barbarian||Lycan|llbarb|3}, you gain these additional benefits:

items: You can choose to grow by one size category.
The reach of your melee attacks increases by 5 feet.
Your walking speed increases by an additional 10 feet.
The damage of your natural weapons becomes {@damage 1d8}.
If you have less than half of your hit points at the start of your turn, you instantly regain hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

activation.condition: When you shift into Animal or Hybrid Form

subclassFeature.name: Howl of Primal Fury
entries: When you expend a use of {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, you can let forth a blood-curdling howl. Creatures of your choice that can hear you within 30 feet must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or be {@condition frightened} of you for up to 1 minute. They can repeat this saving throw at the end of each turn, ending the effect on a success.
Any creature that succeeds on its saving throw against this effect are immune to this feature for the next 24 hours.

activation.condition: When you expend a use of Rage

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Mutant
entries: Barbarians that follow this Primal Path make use of alchemy and dark transmutation magic to mutate their physical form. The savage fury of their Rage triggers massive physiological changes thanks to reagents in their blood. These mutants are often on a quest to evolve their bodies into the ultimate form.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Alchemy
entries: You have a deep knowledge of sinister side of alchemy. You gain proficiency in {@skill Nature} and with {@item alchemist's supplies|phb}.
This knowledge allows you to create mutagens which, when combined with your Rage, radically alter your body.

entries.name: Mutations Known
entries: You know three {@filter Mutations|optionalfeatures|feature type=ll:m} of your choice from the list at the end of this subclass description.
During a long rest, so long as you have access to your alchemist's supplies, you can spend 1 hour to replace one Mutation you know with another Mutation of your choice.
You learn two additional Mutations of your choice when you reach 6th level, 10th level, and a final two at 14th level.

entries.name: Manifest Mutations
entries: When you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, you manifest a number of Mutations equal to your Constitution modifier. These Mutations last until the end of your current Rage.

subclassFeature.name: Enduring Mutation
entries: Your advances in the dark alchemy of mutation have evolved. At the end of each long rest, choose one Mutation you know. You gain the benefits of that Mutation, even when you aren't {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, until the end of your next long rest.
However, when you enter a Rage, your Enduring Mutation counts against the total number of Mutations you can manifest as part of that Rage.

subclassFeature.name: Noxious Strike
entries: You can weaponize the toxins in your blood to infect your foes. When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, roll a {@dice d6}, and the creature immediately suffers the corresponding condition from the table below:

This effect lasts for 1 minute. The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw is immune to the effect of this ability for the next 24 hours.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all of your expended uses when you finish a long rest.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you hit a creature with a melee attack

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Mutation
entries: You have gained mastery over your body's mutability. While {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can use a bonus action to end one Mutation and replace it with another Mutation that you know.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Packleader
entries: Wild warriors all, Barbarians fight with a primal ferocity not seen in civilized soldiers. For some, this savage spirit calls out to the beasts of the wild, and a bond is forged. Known as Packleaders, these primal warriors fight side by side with a Savage Companion, hunting their foes in deadly tandem.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Whisperer
entries: Your wild spirit grants you a special connection with wild beasts. You gain proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling}, and when you make a Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) check related to wild animals, you add double you proficiency bonus to your roll

subclassFeature.name: Savage Companion
entries: You have forged a primal bond with a wild beast known as a Savage Companion. You determine its appearance, but this choice has no effect on its game statistics. Common Savage Companions are wolves, boars, bears, wildcats, and hyenas. Your Companion is friendly to you and your allies, and obeys your commands. It uses the {@creature Savage Companion|llbarb} stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, your Savage Companion acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but it only takes the {@action Dodge} action unless you use a bonus action to command it to take an action from its stat block, or another action.
When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can command your Companion to take the Attack action in place of one attack. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, your Companion acts on its own.

If your Companion is reduced to 0 hit points, it makes death saving throws like a player character would. If your Savage Companion dies, you can spend time during a long rest to seek out a worthy beast from the surrounding wilds to serve as your Savage Companion, so long as such a beast exists. Once you find and bond with such a wild beast, it uses the Savage Companion stat block.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Fury
entries: Your ferocity infects your Companion. While you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, your Savage Companion also gains the benefits of Rage.
Moreover, when you Rage, your Savage Companion can use its reaction to immediately move up to its movement speed and make a Bite or Maul attack.

subclassFeature.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You and your Companion fight as one in battle. Both you and your Savage Companion have advantage on your attack rolls against a creature if the other is within 5 feet of the target creature and they are not {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Howl
entries: You savage spirit rivals that of the great predators of the wild. When you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, either you or your Savage Companion can let forth a wild howl, and force creatures of your choice that can hear it within 30 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} of you or your Companion (whoever howled) for up to 1 minute.
A creature can repeat this saving throw at the start of each turn, ending the effect on a success. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Reaver
entries: While most Barbarians focus on overcoming their foes with raw power and brute force, those known as Reavers augment their impressive strength with martial technique and tactical maneuvers. These fearless warriors are often employed as advance forces, and their combat skill and resilience strikes fear into the heart of any who stand against them in battle.

subclassFeature.name: Swift Strides
entries: Rather than become blinded by Rage, you enter a heightened state of focus and move with purpose. When you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, opportunity attacks against you are made at disadvantage, and whenever you make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check to move or jump, you gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Savage Superiority
entries: You have studied martial techniques to enhance your ability on the fields of battle. You gain the features below:

entries.name: Maneuvers
entries: You learn two {@filter Maneuvers|optionalfeatures|feature type=mv:r} of your choice from the list at the end of this Primal Path. You can use only one Maneuver per attack. When you gain a level, you can replace one Maneuver you know with another Manuever of your choice.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have three Superiority Dice, which are d6s. You must expend one of your Superiority Dice to use one of the Maneuvers you know, and you regain all expended Superiority Dice when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: Some of your Maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the Maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

subclassFeature.name: Improved Technique
entries: Your combat prowess rivals that of heroes of great renown. You gain one additional Superiority Die (for a total of four), and all of your Superiority Dice become {@dice d8}s.
You also learn one additional Maneuver of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Unstoppable Warrior
entries: The chaos of battle heightens your reflexes. While you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you gain the benefits of {@spell freedom of movement}.
You also learn one additional Maneuver of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Storm of Flesh and Steel
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of your training, and woe to any who stand against you on the field of battle. You gain a final Superiority Die (for a total of five), and your Superiority Dice become {@dice d10}s. If you enter a {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1} with no Superiority Dice remaining, you regain one Superiority Die.
You also learn one additional Maneuver of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Titan
entries: Some Barbarians draw their Rage from their ancestry. Those who walk the Path of the Titan fuel their Rage with the giant blood that flows in their veins. While some Titanic warriors are direct descendants of giants, some are unaware of their heritage until it manifests with their Rage. Unusually tall or strong for their race, mortals with giant blood in their veins are fairly obvious once you know the signs to look for.

subclassFeature.name: Fury of the Titans
entries: The fury of your Rage draws out the ancient power of your bloodline. When you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, you gain the following benefits:

items: If there is room, you can choose to grow by one size category for the duration of that Rage. For example, you grow from Medium to Large. Your physical size doubles in all dimensions, and your weight is multiplied by eight.
Your melee and thrown weapon attacks deal bonus damage depending on your current size: Medium ({@damage 1d4}), Large ({@damage 1d6}), Huge ({@damage 1d12}), and Gargantuan ({@damage 2d12}).

subclassFeature.name: Giant Bloodline
entries: Whether by magic or ancestry, you bear the power of giants. Choose the option below that best fits the type of giant whose power resides in you. This choice will affect features you gain later from this Path. You gain resistance to the damage type associated with that giant. This choice is permanent and can't be changed short of a {@spell wish} or the magic of elder giants.

subclassFeature.name: Titanic Vitality
entries: Your Rage draws out an ever-increasing amount of resilience from the power that flows in your blood. When you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Barbarian level.

subclassFeature.name: Awakened Bloodline
entries: The power of your blood is apparent at all times. You gain the features below that correspond to your Giant Bloodline:

subclassFeature.name: Hill Giant
entries: Your body has grown strangely resilient. You have advantage on Constitution saving throws, and when you take damage while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can use a reaction to reduce the damage you take by your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

activation.condition: When you take damage while Raging

subclassFeature.name: Stone Giant
entries: You have become thoughtful. You gain proficiency in {@skill Insight}, and whenever you make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check you treat a roll of 7 or lower on the {@dice d20} as an 8. Moreover, whenever you make a Wisdom saving throw while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Frost Giant
entries: You become especially savage in battle. When you hit a target with a weapon attack, you deal a bonus {@damage 1d6} cold damage on hit. If you deal cold damage to a creature while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Fire Giant
entries: You have become vindictive and cruel. While you are wearing armor you can use your Constitution, in place of Dexterity, to calculate your Armor Class. Also, when you are hit by a melee attack while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can use a reaction to deal fire damage to the attacker equal to your Constitution modifier.

activation.condition: When you are hit by a melee attack while Raging

subclassFeature.name: Cloud Giant
entries: You have become more whimsical and lighthearted. You gain resistance to falling damage, and while you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Giant
entries: You have grown in pride and presence. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe both air and water. Moreover, while you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can cause any thrown weapon attacks you make to deal lighting damage in place of the normal damage for that weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Titanic Wrath
entries: You can strike with the power of a true giant. When you take the {@action Attack} action while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can focus all your power into one strike. You make one attack for this action, even if you have a feature that lets you make more then one attack. On hit, it becomes a critical hit, regardless of your attack roll.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once) and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: When you take the Attack action while Raging

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Warden
entries: Hailing from the wild places of the world where the power of nature reigns supreme, Wardens are servants of the natural order who use the raw power of their Rage to channel spirits of the natural world. They often serve as defenders of sacred groves, Druidic Circles, and other places of natural power.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Magic
entries: When you adopt this Primal Path, you learn to channel the primal power of spirits to cast spells, much like a {@class Shaman|LLSH}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Warden spell list. Upon reaching 10th level in this class you learn one additional Warden cantrip of your choice.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Warden Primal Magic table shows how many spell slots you have, and the level of those spell slots. All of your spell slots from this feature are the same level. To cast one of the Warden spells you know of 1st-level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all of your expended spell slots each time you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you are 7th level, you have two 2nd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell {@spell thunderwave}, you must spend one of those slots, and cast it as a 2nd-level spell.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You learn two 1st-level spells of your choice from the warden spell list. The Spells Known column of the Warden Spellcasting table shows when you learn more warden spells of 1st-level or higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level.
When you gain a level, you can choose a warden spell you know and replace it with another spell from the warden spell list, which must be of a level for which you have spell slots.
When you reach 7th level, for example, you learn a new Warden spell of your choice, which can be 1st or 2nd-level.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: As you draw your magic from your connection to primal spirits, Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your warden spells. You use Wisdom when a spell refers to your spellcasting ability, when setting the saving throw DC for a spell, or when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Rage
entries: You have learned to draw on primal magic, even in your Rage. You can cast Warden spells while you're {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, but you have disadvantage on any Constitution saving throws you make to maintain {@status concentration} on your Warden spells.
Also, casting a spell of 1st-level or higher allows your Rage to continue, even if you don't meet the other requirements.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian's Fury
entries: Your instincts allow you to combine your primal magic with strikes. When you take the {@action Attack} action while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can cast a Warden cantrip in place of one of your attacks.
Moreover, you can use {@classFeature Reckless Attack|Barbarian||2} when you cast a Warden spell that requires a spell attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Ward of the Ancients
entries: You can draw upon your connection to the natural world to shield you from harmful magics. When a creature that you can see damages you with a spell, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to grant yourself resistance to all damage from the triggering spell.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Guardian's Fury
entries: Your Rage and connection with primal spirits have fused to become something that rivals the great destructive forces of nature. When you take the {@action Attack} action while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can cast a Warden spell in place of one of your attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Wyrmblood
entries: Not all who have their blood mingled with dragons manifest sorcerous power. Some instead find themselves imbued with an unquenchable spark of fury. These tyrannical warriors are known as Wyrmbloods, Barbarians fueled by draconic magic.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: Whether by ritual, ancestry, or happenstance, your bloodline bears draconic power. Choose one of the Dragons below that best represents the dragon whose power resides within you. You gain resistance to your Dragon's associated Element.
You also learn to speak, read, and write {@language Draconic}.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Fury
entries: While {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you manifest chromatic scales that grant you a bonus to your Armor Class equal to your Rage damage bonus. Also, once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can deal a bonus {@damage 1d6} Element damage.

activation.condition: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon attack

subclassFeature.name: Tyrannical Resilience
entries: Your blood protects you from magical effects. When you are forced to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw against magic while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

activation.condition: When you are forced to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw against magic while Raging

subclassFeature.name: Breath of the Dragon
entries: The magic of your bloodline allows you to exhale blasts of draconic energy. As a action, you can force creatures in an adjacent 30-foot cone to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). Creatures take {@damage 8d6} damage of your Element type on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful save.

Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. If you have no uses left, you can expend a use of {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1} to use this feature one more time.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Wings
entries: You manifest the full power of your draconic bloodline. As a bonus action, you can manifest a pair of draconic wings. These wings grant you a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and last until you dismiss them as a bonus action.
Clothing or armor that is not made to accommodate your draconic wings might be destroyed when you manifest them.

subclassFeature.name: Alternate Battlerager
entries: The Path of the Battlerager was originally published in the {@book Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide|SCAG}, and is widely accepted as an underwhelming subclass for the Barbarian. The Alternate Battlerager presented here is an attempt to bring this Primal Path up to par with the other official barbarian subclasses.

entries.name: Optional Rule: Dwarves Only
entries: In some settings, only dwarves can train to become Battleragers - known as {@i Kuldjarghs} in {@language Dwarvish}. The GM can elect to use this restriction depending on the setting and cultures present in the game world.

subclassFeature.name: Savage Smith
entries: You are a student of both forge and fury, and have gained the skills necessary to maintain your unique {@subclassFeature Spiked Armor|Barbarian||Alternate Battlerager|llbarb|3}. You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb}, and have advantage on any smith's tools checks you make related to armor.

subclassFeature.name: Spiked Armor
entries: You have learned to modify your armor so you can use it as a weapon. Over the course of an hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can use {@item smith's tools|phb} to affix spikes to a set of armor, turning it into Spiked Armor. Spiked Armor has the following properties, but only when worn by you:

items: It counts as a martial melee weapon with a reach of 5 feet, and on hit, a Spiked Armor attack deals piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier.
While you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you can use a bonus action on your turn to make a single Spiked Armor attack.
When you successfully initiate a {@action grapple}, the grappled creature also takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.

entries: At certain levels, the of your Spiked Armor increases: at 5th level ({@damage 1d6}), 11th level ({@damage 1d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 1d12}).

subclassFeature.name: Reckless Abandon
entries: The thrill and danger of battle ignite your fighting spirit. Once per turn when you make a {@classFeature Reckless Attack|Barbarian||2} while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). If any of these temporary hit points remain when your Rage ends, the immediately dissipate.
In addition, you can turn magical armor into {@subclassFeature Spiked Armor|Barbarian||Alternate Battlerager|llbarb|3}.

activation.condition: Once per turn when you make a Reckless Attack while Raging

subclassFeature.name: Battlerager Charge
entries: Your battle fury compels you to throw yourself into danger. You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}.

subclassFeature.name: Spiked Retribution
entries: When a creature hits you with a melee attack while you are {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging} and wearing your {@subclassFeature Spiked Armor|Barbarian||Alternate Battlerager|llbarb|3}, it takes piercing damage equal to your Strength modifier.
If you are conscious, you can use your reaction to replace this damage with the damage from a Spiked Armor attack.

subclassFeature.name: Alternate Berserker
entries: The savage warriors known as berserkers live for the chaos of battle. For these Barbarians, their Rage is a manifestation of their lust for violence and destruction. Often found on the front lines of battle, berserkers only feel fully alive when they are risking life and limb to test their might against their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Frenzied Rage
entries: Your fury surpases that of even other Barbarians. When you {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}, you can enter a Frenzied Rage. For the duration of a Frenzied Rage you can make a melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each turn, including the bonus action you used to enter your Frenzied Rage.
You can use this feature once with no negative effects, but for each additional time you do so before you finish a long rest, you suffer 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} at the end of that Rage.

subclassFeature.name: Mindless Rage
entries: You give yourself over completely to your Rage. While {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions. If you are charmed or frightened when you enter a Rage, the effect is suspended for the duration of that Rage.
Moreover, while you are in a {@subclassFeature Frenzied Rage|Barbarian||Alternate Berserker|llbarb|3}, you can ignore the effects of any levels of {@condition exhaustion} you currently have.

subclassFeature.name: Menacing Presence
entries: Your menacing presence strikes fear into the hearts of your foes. As a bonus action, you can and force a creature within 30 feet that can see or hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + your proficency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} of you for one minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
If a creature succeeds on its saving throw against this feature, it is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to you Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all of your expended uses each time you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Restoration
entries: You can draw on the spark of fury within you to restore your stamina. Each time you finish a short rest, you can choose to reduce your current level of {@condition exhaustion} by 1.
Once you use this feature to reduce your exhaustion level you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

foundrySystem.activation.condition: Each time you finish a short rest

subclassFeature.name: Furious Retaliation
entries: Your fury knows no bounds. When you take damage from a creature you can see, you can use your reaction to make a single melee or thrown weapon attack against that creature. You can make this reaction attack as a {@classFeature Reckless Attack|Barbarian||2}.

effects.name: Animal Handling Expertise on wild animals

changes.value: When you make a Wisdom (Animal Handling) check related to wild animals, you add double you proficiency bonus to your roll

optionalfeature.name: Aberrant Sight
entries: You sprout unnatural eye stalks or manifest additional eyes. You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a 60-foot radius. Should you have darkvision already, its range increases by 60 feet.
In addition, you have advantage on any Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks you make that rely on your sense of sight.

changes.value: You have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) checks you make that rely on your sense of sight

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Resistance
entries: Your experiments grant you elemental resistance. When you manifest this Mutation choose acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning, and you gain resistance to that damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Aquatic Adaptation
entries: You sprout unnatural gills or you skin becomes permeable and amphibious. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe both air and water.

optionalfeature.name: Deviant Glide
entries: You grow bat or fish-like skin flaps that you use to glide. When you fall and are not {@condition incapacitated}, you can subtract 100 feet from the fall when calculating fall damage, and You can move two feet horizontally for every foot you fall.

activation.condition: When you fall and are not incapacitated

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Movement
entries: Your legs grow unnaturally thick or powerful. Your walking speed increases by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Constitution modifier (minimum of 5 feet), and you can add your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1) to the distance of any long jump or high jump you make.

optionalfeature.name: Oozing Form
entries: Your body becomes slimy and pliable. As a bonus action, you can automatically escape a grapple or nonmagical restraints. Also, your body, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, can squeeze through spaces as narrow as 1 inch.

optionalfeature.name: Synthetic Carapace
entries: Your skin hardens resembling that of an terrible insectoid or reptilian creature. You gain a bonus to your Armor Class equal to half your Constitution modifier (rounded down).

optionalfeature.name: Unnatural Physicality
entries: Your muscles and veins engorge with toxic chemicals that grant you unnatural power and maneuverability. You gain a bonus to any Strength ({@skill Athletics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks you make equal to your Constitution modifier.

foundryEffects.name: Mutations: Athletics and Acrobatics Checks Bonus

optionalfeature.name: Corrosive Secretions
entries: Your body can expel a corrosive acid at your foes. When a creature you can see within 30 feet hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to deal acid damage to your attacker equal to {@damage 1d8} + your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Inoculated Vigor
entries: Your experiments have hardened your body against toxins. You gain resistance to acid and poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws to resist the {@condition poisoned} condition.

changes.value: You have advantage on saving throws to resist the poisoned condition

optionalfeature.name: Toxic Vitality
entries: Your body mends itself as you fight. At the start of your turns while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point).

activation.condition: At the start of your turns while Raging

optionalfeature.name: Viscous Grip
entries: Your hands and feet secrete a sticky substance. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you can climb difficult surfaces without making an ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Acidic Bile
entries: You can spew a corrosive substance forth from your mouth. You learn the {@spell acid splash} cantrip, and Constitution is your spellcasting modifier for it. You can cast this cantrip while {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1||Raging}, and when you do, it deals additional damage equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

activation.condition: When you cast Acid Splash while Raging

optionalfeature.name: Grappling Appendages
entries: You grow two appendages alongside your arms that resemble tentacles. They are natural weapons, which deal bludgeoning damage equal to your {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier on hit. If you hit a creature with a melee appendage attack, you can attempt to {@action grapple} it as a bonus action on that same turn. The appendages aren't dexterous enough to use weapons or specialized tools.

optionalfeature.name: Perverted Flight
entries: You sprout leathery or insectoid wings. You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Ambush
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check or an initiative roll, you can expend one superiority die and add the die to the roll, provided you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Bait and Switch
entries: When you're within 5 feet of a creature on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and switch places with that creature, provided you spend at least 5 feet of movement and the creature is willing and isn't {@condition incapacitated}. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.
Roll the superiority die. Until the start of your next turn, you or the other creature (your choice) gains a bonus to AC equal to the number rolled.

optionalfeature.name: Brace
entries: When a creature you can see moves into the reach you have with the melee weapon you're wielding, you can use your reaction to expend one superiority die and make one attack against the creature, using that weapon. If the attack hits, add the superiority die to the weapon's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Disarming Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of your choice that it's holding. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the object you choose. The object lands at its feet.

optionalfeature.name: Goading Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to goad the target into attacking you. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Grappling Strike
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and then try to grapple the target as a bonus action (see the Player's Handbook for rules on grappling). Add the superiority die to your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

optionalfeature.name: Lunging Attack
entries: When you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die to increase your reach for that attack by 5 feet. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Menacing Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to frighten the target. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to reduce the damage by the number you roll on your superiority die + your Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Precision Attack
entries: When you make a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this maneuver before or after making the attack roll, but before any effects of the attack are applied.

optionalfeature.name: Pushing Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to drive the target back. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target up to 15 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to make a melee weapon attack against the creature. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeping Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to damage another creature with the same attack. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to the number you roll on your superiority die. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.

optionalfeature.name: Trip Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Hit Dice
entries: Your Companion has a total number of {@dice d8} Hit Dice equal to your Barbarian level. It also gains all the normal benefits of both short and long rests.

trait.name: Primal Bond
entries: You add your PB to any ability check or saving throw your Companion makes.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: Your Companion has advantage on any ability check that relies on sight, hearing, or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +2 +PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 +2 +PB} piercing damage.
On hit, the creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 10 + PB) or be {@condition grappled}. Your Companion can only grapple one target at a time.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} +2 +PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 +2 +PB} piercing damage.
